parts.title: SECTION 1
parts.content:
HUGO: Hi Chantal. What did you think of the talk, then?

CHANTAL: Hi Hugo. I thought it was good once I'd moved seats.

HUGO: Oh- were the people beside you chatting or something?

CHANTAL: {[It wasn't that. I went early so that I'd get a seat and not have to stand, but then this guy sat right in front of me and he was so tall!][21]}

HUGO: {[It's hard to see through people's heads, isn't it?][21]}

CHANTAL: {[Impossible!][21]} Anyway, to answer your question, I thought it was really interesting, especially what the speaker said about the job market.

HUGO: Me too. I mean we know we're going into a really competitive field so it's obvious that we may struggle to get work.

CHANTAL: That's right -- and we know we can't all have that 'dream job'.

HUGO: {[Yeah, but it looks like there's a whole range of ... areas of work that we hadn't even thought of -- like fashion journalism, for instance.][22]}

CHANTAL: Yeah -- I wasn't expecting so many career options.

HUGO: Mmm. Overall, she had quite a strong message, didn't she?

CHANTAL: She did. She kept saying things like 'I know you all think this, but ...' and then she'd tell us how it really is.

HUGO: Perhaps she thinks students are a bit narrow-minded about the industry.

CHANTAL: It was a bit harsh, though! We know it's a tough industry.

HUGO: {[Yeah -- and we're only first years, after all. We've got a lot to learn.][23]}

CHANTAL: Exactly. Do you think our secondary-school education should have been more career-focused?

HUGO: {[Well, we had numerous talks on careers, which was good, but none of them were very inspiring. They could have asked more people like today's speaker to talk to us.][24]}

CHANTAL: I agree. We were told about lots of different careers -- just when we needed to be, but not by the experts who really know stuff.

HUGO: So did today's talk influence your thoughts on what career you'd like to take up in the future?

CHANTAL: {[Well. I promised myself that I'd go through this course and keep an open mind till the end.][25]}

HUGO: {[But I think it's better to pick an area of the industry now and then aim to get better and better at it.][25]}

CHANTAL: {[Well, I think we'll just have to differ on that issue!][25]}

HUGO: One thing's for certain, though. From what she said, we'll be unpaid assistants in the industry for quite a long time.

CHANTAL: Mmm.

HUGO: {[I'm prepared for that, aren't you?][26]}

CHANTAL: Actually, I'm not going to accept that view.

HUGO: Really? But she knows it's the case - and everyone else says the same.

CHANTAL: That doesn't mean it has to be true for me.

HUGO: OK. Well -- I hope you're right!

CHANTAL: I thought the speaker's account of her first job was fascinating.

HUGO: Yeah -- she admitted she was lucky to get work being a personal dresser for a musician. She didn't even apply for the job and there she was getting paid to choose all his clothes.

CHANTAL: It must have felt amazing -- though she said all she was looking for back then was experience, not financial reward.

HUGO: {[Mmm. And then he was so mean, telling her she was more interested in her own appearance than his!][27-28]}

CHANTAL: But -- she did realise he was right about that, which really made me think. I'm always considering my own clothes but now I can see you should be focusing on your client!

HUGO: She obviously regretted losing the job.

CHANTAL: {[Well, as she said, she should have hidden her negative feelings about him, but she didn't.][27-28]}

HUGO: It was really brave the way she picked herself up and took that job in retail. Fancy working in a shop after that!

CHANTAL: Yeah -- well, she recommended we all do it at some point. I guess as a designer you'd get to find out some useful information, like how big or small the average shopper is.

HUGO: I think that's an issue for manufacturers, not designers. {[However, it would be useful to know if there's a gap in the market -- you know, an item that no one's stocking but that consumers are looking for.][29-30]}

CHANTAL: Yeah, people don't give up searching. They also take things back to the store if they aren't right.

HUGO: {[Yeah. Imagine you worked in an expensive shop and you found out the garments sold there were being returned because they ... fell apart in the wash!][29-30]}

CHANTAL: Yeah, it would be good to know that kind of thing.

HUGO: Yeah.

questions.title: Question 1
questions.explain: Greg mentions "So this is a position for a receptionist" at the beginning of the conversation.

questions.title: Question 2
questions.explain: Greg states "it's at the medical centre there" when describing the job location.

questions.title: Question 3
questions.explain: Greg mentions "It's quite near the station, on Chastons Road" and spells it out.

questions.title: Question 4
questions.explain: Greg explains "you'd also be involved in making appointments" as part of the job duties.

questions.title: Question 5
questions.explain: Greg mentions "keeping the centre's database up-to-date" as one of the duties.

questions.title: Question 6
questions.explain: Greg states "one thing they do require is someone with experience".

questions.title: Question 7
questions.explain: Greg describes the requirement to "stay calm, and at the same time be confident".

questions.title: Question 8
questions.explain: Greg clarifies "this isn't a permanent job, it's temporary".

questions.title: Question 9
questions.explain: Greg answers "One fifteen" when Julie asks about the finishing time.

questions.title: Question 10
questions.explain: Julie asks "is there parking available for staff at the centre?" and Greg confirms it.

question_sets.title: Complete the notes below
question_sets.description: Write ONE WORD AND/OR A NUMBER for each answer.\nWrite your answers in boxes {start_question} - {end_question} on your answer sheet.
question_sets.content:
Job details from employment agency

Role ______

Location Fordham ______ Centre

______ Road, Fordham

Work involves

● dealing with enquiries

● making ______ and reorganising them

● maintaining the internal ______

● general administration

Requirements

● ______ (essential)

● a calm and ______ manner

● good IT skills

Other information

● a ______ job – further opportunities may be available

● hours: 7.45 a.m. to ______ p.m. Monday to Friday

● ______ is available onsite

parts.transcription: [{"to": 45.545, "from": 44.905, "text": "Hello?", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 48.105, "from": 45.785, "text": "Oh, hello. Is that Julie Davison?", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 48.905, "from": 48.105, "text": "Yes.", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 57.07, "from": 49.065, "text": "This is Greg Preston from the employment agency. We met last week when you came in to inquire about office work.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 58.35, "from": 57.07, "text": "Oh, that's right.", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 63.71, "from": 58.75, "text": "Now we've just had some details come in of a job which might interest you.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 64.59, "from": 63.71, "text": "Okay.", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 72.345, "from": 65.07, "text": "So this is a position for a receptionist. I believe you've done that sort of work before?", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 78.825, "from": 72.345, "text": "Yes. I have. I worked in a sports center for a couple of years before I got married and had the children.", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 87.12, "from": 79.065, "text": "Right. Well, this job's in Fordham, so not too far away for you, and it's at the medical center there.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 90.0, "from": 87.12, "text": "Okay. So where exactly is that?", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 93.92, "from": 90.08, "text": "It's quite near the station on Chastons Road.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 94.799995, "from": 93.92, "text": "Sorry?", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 106.015, "from": 95.2, "text": "Chastons Road. That's C H A S T 0 N S.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 112.015, "from": 106.335, "text": "Okay. Thanks. So what would the work involve? Dealing with inquiries from patients?", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 122.64, "from": 112.015, "text": "Yes. And you'd also be involved in making appointments, whether face to face or on the phone, and rescheduling them if necessary.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 124.72, "from": 122.880005, "text": "Fine. That shouldn't be a problem.", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 138.24501, "from": 125.200005, "text": "And another of your duties would be keeping the center's database up to date. Then you might have other general administrative duties as well, but those would be the main ones.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 138.80501, "from": 138.485, "text": "Okay.", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 210.01999, "from": 195.585, "text": "Now when the details came in, I immediately thought of you because one thing they do require is someone with experience. And you did mention your work at the sports center when you came in to see us.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 215.115, "from": 210.01999, "text": "Yes. In fact, I enjoyed that job. Is there anything else they're looking for?", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 235.24, "from": 215.515, "text": "Well, they say it's quite a high pressure environment. They're always very busy, and patients are often under stress, so they want someone who can cope with that and stay calm, and at the same time be confident when interacting with the public.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 240.68, "from": 235.31999, "text": "Well, after dealing with three children all under five, I reckon I can cope with that.", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 249.905, "from": 240.68, "text": "I'm sure you can. And then another thing they mention is that they're looking for someone with good IT skills.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 251.10501, "from": 249.905, "text": "Not a problem.", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 254.225, "from": 251.425, "text": "So you'd be interested in following this up?", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 256.305, "from": 254.225, "text": "Sure. When would it start?", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 274.655, "from": 256.87, "text": "Well, they're looking for someone from the beginning of next month. But I should tell you that this isn't a permanent job. It's temporary, so the contract would be just at the September. But they do say that there could be further opportunities after that.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 277.535, "from": 274.655, "text": "Okay. And what would the hours be?", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 283.375, "from": 277.775, "text": "Well, they want someone who can start at a quarter to eight in the morning. Could you manage that?", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 293.50998, "from": 283.83, "text": "Yes. My husband would have to get the kids up and off to my mother's. She's going to be looking after them while I'm at work. What time would I finish?", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 294.71, "from": 293.59, "text": "01:15.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 306.285, "from": 295.03, "text": "That should work out alright. I can pick the kids up on my way home, and then I'll have the afternoon with them. Oh, one thing. Is there parking available for staff at the center?", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 309.965, "from": 306.285, "text": "Yes. There is. And it's also on a bus route.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 317.43002, "from": 310.125, "text": "Right. Well, I expect I'll have the car, but it's good to know that. Okay. So where do I go from here?", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 330.92502, "from": 317.91, "text": "Well, if you're happy for me to do so, I'll forward your CV and references, and then the best thing would probably be for you to phone them so they can arrange for an interview.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}, {"to": 333.24503, "from": 330.92502, "text": "Great. Well, thank you very much.", "speaker": "HUGO"}, {"to": 335.64502, "from": 333.325, "text": "You're welcome. Bye now. Bye.", "speaker": "CHANTAL"}]

question_sets.title: Questions 11-14
question_sets.description: Choose the correct letter, A, B or C.\nWrite your answers in boxes {start_question} - {end_question} on your answer sheet.

questions.title: Question 11
questions.explain: The guide mentions it was constructed as the home of a local businessman.

questions.title: Question 12
questions.explain: The guide states "You may see students going into the building for lessons".
questions.text: The university uses part of the museum building as

questions.title: Question 13
questions.explain: The guide mentions "We do have a donation box" suggesting voluntary payment.
questions.text: What does the guide say about the entrance fee?

options.text: Visitors decide whether or not they wish to pay.
Only children and students receive a discount.
The museum charges extra for special exhibitions.

questions.title: Question 14
questions.explain: The guide suggests leaving "heavy rucksacks" in the cloakroom.
questions.text: What are visitors advised to leave in the cloakroom?

question_sets.title: Questions 15-20
question_sets.description: What information does the speaker give about each of the following areas of the museum? Choose SIX answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-H, next to Questions {start_question}-{end_question}.

options.text: There are new animals to see
There is a quiz to complete
There is a quiz to complete
You can buy products from this area

questions.title: Question 15
questions.explain: The guide mentions it was designed by students on a film studies course.

questions.title: Question 16
questions.explain: The guide mentions demonstrations of cheese-making in this area.

questions.title: Question 17
questions.explain: The guide mentions visitors can take a memory test in this room.

questions.title: Question 18
questions.explain: The guide warns visitors not to touch or climb on the old carts.

questions.title: Question 19
questions.explain: The guide mentions this area is being redeveloped and cannot be visited.

questions.title: Question 20
questions.explain: The guide mentions there are baby ducks and tiny frogs that are new arrivals.

question_sets.title: Question 21
question_sets.description: Which TWO educational skills were shown in the video of children doing origami?\nChoose TWO letters from A-E.\nWrite your answers in box {start_question} on your answer sheet.

questions.title: Question 21
questions.explain: The students discuss following instructions and learning through play as skills demonstrated in the video.
questions.text: Which TWO educational skills were shown in the video of children doing origami?

question_sets.title: Questions 23-27
question_sets.description: Which comment do the students make about each of the following children in the video? Choose FIVE answers from the box and write the correct letter, A-G, next to Questions {start_question}-{end_question}.

options.text: tried out different ways of doing things
asked for help from other children
wanted to make the best model in the class
benefited from using their hands to focus
appeared confused about what to do
made an excellent model very easily

questions.title: Question 23
questions.explain: The students noted that Sid benefited from using his hands to help him settle down and concentrate.

questions.title: Question 24
questions.explain: The students observed that Jack tried out different things rather than asking for help.

questions.title: Question 25
questions.explain: The students mentioned that Naomi wanted her mouse to be the best and that motivated her to try harder.

questions.title: Question 26
questions.explain: The students noted that Anya produced the perfect bird with very little effort.

questions.title: Question 27
questions.explain: The students observed that Zara seemed unsure about what she was supposed to do.

question_sets.title: Questions 28-30
question_sets.description: Choose the correct letter, A, B or C.\nWrite your answers in boxes {start_question} - {end_question} on your answer sheet.

questions.title: Question 28
questions.explain: The students discussed the importance of preparing examples showing each step.
questions.text: Before starting an origami activity in class, the students think it is important for the teacher to

options.text: make models that demonstrate the different stages.
check children understand the terminology involved.
tell children not to worry if they find the activity difficult.

questions.title: Question 29
questions.explain: The students discussed how teachers might feel clumsy and lack manual skills.
questions.text: The students agree that some teachers might be unwilling to use origami in class because

options.text: they may not think that crafts are important.
they may not have the necessary skills.
they may worry that it will take up too much time.

questions.title: Question 30
questions.explain: The students plan to use origami to present fractions, which is a new concept coming up.
questions.text: Why do the students decide to use origami in their maths teaching practice?

question_sets.title: Complete the notes below
question_sets.description: Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.\nWrite your answers in boxes {start_question} - {end_question} on your answer sheet.
question_sets.content:
Victor Hugo

His novel, Les Misérables

● It has been adapted for theatre and cinema.

● We know more about its overall ______ than about its author.

His early career

● In Paris, his career was successful and he was a leading figure of the Romantic movement.

● He spoke publicly about social issues, especially ______.

● Napoleon III forced him to leave Paris and live in other parts of ______.

Victor Hugo's house

● He bought the property with money he had made from ______.

● On the ground floor, there are portraits and ______ from his travels.

● He created dark wood panelling for the walls from old ______.

● In the red and blue lounges, he made ______ by copying Chinese designs.

● The Lookout room has views over the ______ and was used for writing.

● He invited local ______ from disadvantaged areas to dinner weekly.

● In 1927, his ______ donated the house to the city of Paris.

questions.title: Question 31
questions.explain: The speaker mentions "we know much less about the author" in contrast to knowing about the plot.

questions.title: Question 32
questions.explain: The speaker mentions Hugo gave speeches about "the level of poverty in his society".

questions.title: Question 33
questions.explain: The speaker states "Victor Hugo was forced to reside in other parts of Europe".

questions.title: Question 34
questions.explain: The speaker mentions he bought the house "using the money he'd made from the publication of a collection of his poetry".

questions.title: Question 35
questions.explain: The speaker mentions "portraits and drawings that he did during his travels".

questions.title: Question 36
questions.explain: The speaker describes how he "created wooden furniture that he bought in the market".

questions.title: Question 37
questions.explain: The speaker mentions "Chinese influence in things like the wallpaper pattern and the lamps".

questions.title: Question 38
questions.explain: The speaker describes "the Lookout - called that because it looks out over the harbour".

questions.title: Question 39
questions.explain: The speaker mentions "he invited a large group of local children from the deprived areas".

questions.title: Question 40
questions.explain: The speaker states "the house was owned by his relatives, and they decided to donate it".
